title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, September 10, 1863
summary: Nadenbousch has sent a messenger to his wife and asks her to relay information through him regarding the state of affairs at home and the possibility of moving the family to Staunton. He has rented a house there and sends directions to prepare for the trip.
keywords: African Americans, Family, Home Front, Race Relations, Slavery, Women, American Civil War
